title: A bomb hit this theatre hiding hundreds - here's how one woman survived
description: The BBC speaks to survivors of the Mariupol theatre attack, who describe for the first time what happened.

title: Liverpool and Manchester mayors want FA Cup semi-final switched from Wembley
description: The FA Cup semi-final between Liverpool and Manchester City should be moved from Wembley, say the mayors of both cities.

title: Homes for Ukraine: 'It's sad, slow and frustrating'
description: Families desperate to host Ukrainians in need call for the process to be quicker, with less red tape.

title: William Collins: Giant memorial built without permission
description: The huge marble tribute in Sheffield has become a minor attraction - but its future is in doubt.

title: Ukraine: The small town which managed to block Russia's big plans
description: The mayor of Voznesensk hails the "fighting spirit" of local people who drove Russian troops back.

title: When and where can I ride an e-scooter legally?
description: London is the latest UK city to trial e-scooters - which the government hopes will be a more environmentally-friendly way to travel.

title: Ukraine's recruits swap spreadsheets for sniper rifles to defend Kyiv
description: Preparing to defend Kyiv, Ukraine's new recruits must learn a new way of life - how to fight.

title: Russia Navalny: Putin critic jailed for nine more years trial branded 'sham'
description: Alexei Navalny is to be sent to a maximum security jail after a judge gave him nine more years in jail.

title: Cost of living: 'It feels like I'm being priced out of existence'
description: Some disabled people say they are switching off their heating to cope with spiralling energy bills.

title: Petrol prices stabilise after weeks at record highs
description: Average petrol prices fall slightly from record high of £1.67 per litre, the RAC says.

title: Daniel Morgan: Met Police approach to tackling corruption is flawed, watchdog finds
description: The report comes after the failed investigation into the 1987 murder of private investigator Daniel Morgan.

title: St Helens dog attack: Girl aged 17 months killed at home
description: The dog that attacked 17-month-old Bella-Rae Birch in St Helens was killed by police.

title: Spring Statement: Borrowing figures give Rishi Sunak 'wiggle room'
description: One influential economist says government borrowing this year could be about £25bn less than expected.

title: Sabita Thanwani: Man in court over murder of student at university halls
description: Maher Maaroufe is charged with murdering Sabita Thanwani, who died at her student accommodation.

title: Birmingham pub bombings: Chris Mullin allowed to keep source secret
description: A court rules Chris Mullin may guard a source over the Birmingham pub bombings despite police pressure.

title: China plane crash rescuers find charred personal belongings
description: Families of the 132 people on board have gathered at a nearby airport waiting anxiously for updates.

title: Covid in Wales: Face mask and isolation rules could be extended
description: Ministers planned to scrap them on 28 March but have not yet decided whether to go ahead.

title: UK to fully compensate postmasters who exposed scandal
description: Staff who uncovered the Post Office IT scandal but missed out on full compensation will get payouts.

title: Terror alert level in Northern Ireland lowered
description: Secretary of State Brandon Lewis says the move from a severe to substantial level is based on MI5 intelligence.

title: Colbrelli 'OK and conscious' but will have more tests after collapse
description: Sonny Colbrelli will have further tests in hospital following Monday's collapse at the Volta a Catalunya.

title: Freeing Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe took too long, Jeremy Hunt says
description: The former foreign secretary insists he did all he could but calls for an independent inquiry.

title: 'What a goal!' Young goalkeeper scores amazing long-range winner
description: A video of Charlie Clarke scoring from inside his own half is watched more than a million times.

title: Malmö: Two women killed after violent attack at Swedish school
description: An 18-year-old student is arrested on suspicion of murder after two deaths in the city of Malmö.

title: Rejecting Bayern and emulating Souness in Serie A - Scotland's new superstar Hickey
description: BBC Scotland charts 19-year-old Aaron Hickey's rise to prominence at Hearts, his move to Bologna instead of Bayern Munich, and Scotland recognition.

title: Lanning century leads Australia to sixth straight World Cup win
description: Meg Lanning scores a magnificent unbeaten 135 as Australia beat South Africa by five wickets to make it six successive wins at the Women's World Cup.

title: Cherry West: From schoolboy Sam to drag teen
description: Sam Carlin, 15, found his passion for drag while on a family holiday in Lanzarote five years ago.

title: Ukraine war: Belarusian dissidents fight against Russia in Ukraine
description: Belarusian dissident Pavel Kulazhanka left his life in New York to join the fight against Russia.

title: Historic England: 100 years of aerial images go online
description: Landmarks in the West Midlands feature among more than 400,000 photos uploaded by Historic England.

title: The Papers: Putin's Mariupol threat and Gove 'target of plot'
description: The invasion of Ukraine leads many front pages while others focus on an alleged plot to kill Michael Gove.

title: Bridgerton: South Asian faces on TV 'makes me happy'
description: The casting in Bridgerton's new season is opening up an important conversation, aspiring actors say.

title: Hobbyist satellite watchers change our view of war
description: An unprecedented supply of images gives a unique overview of events unfolding on the ground.

title: Hard choices for surrogate mothers and parents
description: Hundreds of Ukrainian women are pregnant with other people's children - creating a web of complex problems.

title: Asakaa: How drill music found a new home in Ghana
description: Asakaa, or Ghana drill, is the latest hot sound from Africa, following the global success of Afrobeats.

title: Oscars 2022: The best picture nominees in 60 seconds
description: Ten films are up for the best picture Academy Award - here they are in a minute.

title: Sudan: BBC investigation shows abuse of female demonstrators
description: The BBC has identified a number of female protesters who have been physically and sexually assaulted by security forces in Sudan.

title: Evangelicalism & Brazil: The religious movement that spread through a national team
description: Evangelicalism within Brazil's national football team has been on the rise, mirroring a wider trend across the country.
